thread.title: Detroit Pistons waive three players, including Cartier Martin
thread.title_full: Detroit Pistons waive three players, including Cartier Martin

author: freep.com
title: Detroit Pistons waive three players, including Cartier Martin
text:
MORE The Detroit Pistons today waived forward Cartier Martin, guard/forward Adonis Thomas and center Jordan Bachynski.
The Pistons now have 16 guaranteed contracts on the roster, with the status of small forward Danny Granger still to be decided.
Granger, 32, who once was an NBA All-Star, only to have his career stalled by injuries, was allowed to remain in Arizona to rehab this preseason . He isn't expected to be part of the team's 15-man opening-night roster.
Granger was part of the Phoenix Suns' salary dump that brought the Pistons forward Marcus Morris and Reggie Bullock , who has won the final roster spot over Martin and Thomas.
DETROIT FREE PRESS
Pistons might pick up Reggie Bullock's 2016-17 option
Martin signed with the Pistons as a free agent in 2014. In 23 games with Detroit, he averaged 1.6 points, 0.9 rebounds and 0.5 assists in 8.6 minutes per game. In 243 career games (15 starts) with Charlotte, Golden State, Washington, Atlanta, Chicago and Detroit, Martin has averages of 5.1 points, 1.9 rebounds, 0.5 assists and 13.8 minutes.
Thomas was signed in July, after spending last season with the Grand Rapids Drive, the Pistons' NBA Development League affiliate. Thomas has spent two seasons in the D-League, where he averaged 18 points, 4.6 rebounds and 1.4 assists in 85 games with the Drive and the Springfield Armor.
Bachynski was signed to the training camp roster Sept. 28. In two preseason games, he totaled six points and one rebound in six minutes. The 7-foot-2, 248-pound center played at Arizona State and went undrafted in 2014.
DETROIT FREE PRESS
Pistons' Bullock offers ability to play within offense
